title: Consciousness qua Mortal Computation
abstract: arXiv:2403.03925v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Computational functionalism posits that consciousness is a computation. Here we show, perhaps surprisingly, that it cannot be a Turing computation. Rather, computational functionalism implies that consciousness is a novel type of computation that has recently been proposed by Geoffrey Hinton, called mortal computation.

translated_abstract: 计算功能主义认为意识是一种计算。在这里，我们展示出，或许令人惊讶的是，它不能是图灵计算。相反，计算功能主义暗示着意识是一种新型计算，由Geoffrey Hinton最近提出，称为有限计算。
tldr: 意识被看作是一种新型的计算，称为有限计算，这与传统的图灵计算不同。
en_tdlr: Consciousness is considered as a novel type of computation, termed mortal computation, which differs from traditional Turing computation.
